derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via late Latin from Greek orphanos 'bereaved'

encyclopedia.content: 导演： 佐米·希尔拉编剧： David Johnson / Alex Mace 主演： 伊莎贝拉·弗尔曼 / 吉米·本内特 / Lorry Ayers / 维拉·法米加 / 彼得·萨斯加德 类型：剧情 / 悬疑 / 惊悚 制片国家/地区： 美国 / 加拿大 / 德国 / 法国 语言： 英语 / 美国手语 / 爱沙尼亚语 上映日期：2009-07-24 片长：123 分钟 又名： 孤儿怨 / 孤疑 / 孤女疯劫 / Esther 简 介 一对夫妇收养了一个9岁的女孩，然而之后他们却发现自己的亲生儿子失踪了，而这

entry.def: An orphan is a child whose parents are dead.

example.ex: I'm an orphan and pretty much grew up on my own.
example.tran: 我是个孤儿，差不多是靠自己长大的。

example.ex: ...a young orphan girl brought up by peasants...
example.tran: 由农民抚养长大的幼小孤女

entry.def: If a child is orphaned, their parents die, or their remaining parent dies.

example.ex: Jones was orphaned at the age of ten, and taken in by next-door neighbours...
example.tran: 琼斯10岁时成为孤儿，被隔壁的邻居收养。

example.ex: By the end of the decade, some ten million children are expected to have been orphaned by the disease.
example.tran: 到这个10年结束时，大约1,000万儿童将会因为这种疾病而失去双亲。

means.word_mean: 1. a child who has lost both parents
2. someone or something who lacks support or care or supervision
3. the first line of a paragraph that is set as the last line of a page or column
4. a young animal without a mother
1. deprived of parents by death or desertion

Sentence.sentence: Google will be able to display up to 20% of orphan works for free, include them in its subscription deals to libraries and sell them to individual buyers under the consumer licence.
Books whose copyright holders are not known are called orphan works
